MySQL Cheat Sheet

Database

// Show all databases on MySQL server.
SHOW DATABASES;
// Create new database.
CREATE DATABASE database_name;
// Use database. (Select)
USE database_name;
// Drop database. (Destroy database.)
DROP DATABASE database_name;

Engines

// Show all available engines on MySQL Server.
SHOW ENGINES;
// Change table engine.
ALTER TABLE table_name TYPE = engine_name;
InnoDB // Supports transactions, row-level locking, and foreign keys.
MyISAM // MyISAM storage engine.
MEMORY // Hash based, stored in memory, useful for temporary tables.
FEDERATED // Federated MySQL storage engine.

Table

// Show all tables inside selected database.
SHOW TABLES;
// Create table.
CREATE TABLE table_name ( column_name data_type constraint, column_name data_type constraint, ... ) ENGINE = engine_type // Engine is optional.
COMMENT = engine_type; // Comment is optional.
// Show all table columns.
DESCRIBE table_name;
// Show table informations.
SHOW TABLE STATUS LIKE 'table_name' \G // Quotes reqired
// Rename table.
RENAME TABLE table_name TO table_name_new;
// Rename table column.
ALTER TABLE table_name CHANGE COLUMN column_name column_name_new data_type;
// Insert new column.
ALTER TABLE table_name ADD COLUMN column_name data_type [ FIRST | AFTER ] existing_column;
// Drop column.
ALTER TABLE table_name DROP COLUMN column_name;
// Delete all records from table.
TRUNCATE table_name;
// Drop table. ( Destroy table )
DROP TABLE table_name;

Inserts

// Insert all values in table.
INSERT INTO table_name VALUES (value1, value2, value3, ...);
// Insert into specific columns;
INSERT INTO table_name (column_name, column_name, column_name, ...) VALUES (value1, value2, value3, ...);

Data types

// n - length

Text types:

CHARACTER(n) // Character string fixed n.
VARCHAR(n) // Character string max n. Can Store up to 255 characters.
TEXT // Holds a string with a maximum length of 65,535 characters.
MEDIUMTEXT // Holds a string with a maximum length of 16,777,215 characters.
LONGTEXT // Holds a string with a maximum length of 4,294,967,295 characters.
BLOB // For BLOBs (Binary Large Objects). Holds up to 65,535 bytes of data.
MEDIUMBLOB // For BLOBs (Binary Large Objects). Holds up to 16,777,215 bytes of data.
LONGBLOB // For BLOBs (Binary Large Objects). Holds up to 4,294,967,295 bytes of data.
ENUM(x, y, z, ... ) // Let you enter a list of possible values. You can list up to 65535 values in an ENUM list.
SET // Similar to ENUM except that SET may contain up to 64 list items and can store more than one choice.

Number types:

SMALLINT // Integer numerical. -32,768 to +32,767
INTEGER(n) or INT // Integer numerical. -2,147,483,648 to +2,147,483,647 * UNSIGNED
BIGINT // Integer numerical. -2^63 to 2^63 - 1
DECIMAL(n, s) // Example: decimal(5,2) is a number that has 3 digits before the decimal and 2 digits after the decimal.
FLOAT // Approximate numerical.
DOUBLE // Approximate numerical.

Date types:

DATE // Stores year, month, and day values.
TIME // Stores hour, minute, and second values.
TIMESTAMP // Stores year, month, day, hour, minute, and second values.
YEAR // A year in two-digit or four-digit format.

Uncategorized:

BOOLEAN // Stores true or false.
ARRAY // A set-length and ordered collection of elements.
MULTISET // A variable-length and unordered collection of elements.
XML // Stores XML data.

Constraints

NOT NULL // Ensures that a column cannot have a NULL value.
UNIQUE // Ensures that all values in a column are different.
PRIMARY KEY // A combination of a NOT NULL and UNIQUE. Uniquely identifies each row in a table.
FOREIGN KEY // Uniquely identifies a row/record in another table.
CHECK // Ensures that all values in a column satisfies a specific condition.
DEFAULT // Sets a default value for a column when no value is specified.
INDEX // Use to create and retrieve data from the database very quickly.
